actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Armed Services.
Reported to House from the Committee on Armed Services, H. Rept. 95-72.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Referred to Senate Committee on Armed Services.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Armed Services with amendment, S. Rept. 95-1138.
House agreed to Senate amendments with amendments.

official_title: An Act to amend title 10, United States Code, to make certain changes in the Retired Serviceman's Family Protection Plan and the Survivor Benefit Plan as authorized by chapter 73 of that title, and for other purposes.

summary.as: House agreed to Senate amendment with amendment
summary.text: (House agreed to Senate amendments with amendments) Uniformed Services Survivors' Benefits Amendments - =Title I: Annuities Under Retired Serviceman's Family Protection Plan= - Requires increase in the annuities payable under the Retired Serviceman's Family Protection Plan (RSFPP) to spouses or children of deceased members of the armed forces who died before March 20, 1974, whenever retired or retainer pay is increased to reflect changes in the Consumer Price Index. Makes such adjustments retroactive for retired or retainer pay adjustments since September 21, 1972. Permits RSFPP plan annuities to continue upon remarriage after age 60. =Title II: Annuities Under Survivor Benefit Plan= - Grants annuities to the survivors of individuals who would have been eligible for retired military pay for non-regular service but who died before reaching the age of 60. Establishes formulae for computing such benefits. =Title III: Medical and Dental Care= - Entitles such survivors to specified medical and dental benefits.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 10, United States Code, to make certain changes in the Retired Serviceman's Family Protection Plan and the Survivor Benefit Plan as authorized by chapter 73 of that title.

An Act to amend title 10, United States Code, to make certain changes in the Retired Serviceman's Family Protection Plan and the Survivor Benefit Plan as authorized by chapter 73 of that title, and for other purposes.
